group_1.progressNarration: [textBlack:The offshoot Mirrors connecting Kamihama and@Futatsugi. A bloody battle waged on between@the Union, who were trying to erase@the shortcut, and Promised Blood,@who sought to protect it,@with the Union claiming victory@as the curtain closed upon the stage.]
[textBlack:But the Union had paid the price for itー@the life of a Magical Girl.@Their future actions became uncertain@as a dark shadow loomed over them.]
[textBlack:While that fierce battle took place,@I was watching over Miss Mitama.]
[textBlack:As Kamihama wavers@in the midst of its mayoral election,@I feel as if I can confirm my previous idea@that society as a whole@creates Magical Girls, not Kyubey.]
[textBlack:Also during this time,@in Yukuni City, far from Kamihama,@Ms. Nayuta Satomi continued her search@for her father.]
[textBlack:At the time, I did not have the faintest idea.@I did not know that what happened@between Miss Mitama and Miss Nayuta@was connected...]

group_1.narration: The problem of disparity between the east and west@has been a topic of discussion for quite a long time,@but the effects of this election are going to have@a major impact on the citizens living here.

group_1.textLeft: There's nothing we can do now,@and then tomorrow, they'll call for the ballots.

group_1.textRight: Even though Sis was helping too...
We didn't do well even with all the people who gave their support...?

group_1.textLeft: Kanagi told me everything would be just fine,
but this kind of looks not so fine...

group_1.textRight: <Miss Mitama, you were helping out@along with others at the office, correct?>

group_1.textLeft: Yep, since there's the issue of age, it's work I can do@that isn't campaigning for the election.
...Let's see.
Because I do want to like my city@at least a little bit...maybe...
You see, the truth is I actually hate the people@of Kamihama, regardless of east or west.
I've had a lot happen in my past...
But, you know, with a disaster striking and everyone@in Kamihama currently trying to support each other,
I feel like the people are beginning to change a little.
If the eastern candidate puts up a good fight,
I feel like the people's impression of the east@will change dramatically.
We're not dangerous;@we're just like everyone else.
If everyone's viewpoints change, then my impression@of Kamihama will change, too.
That's why I've worked so hard.
Besides, it would also make the city better for Mii@to live in.

group_1.textRight: That kind of stuff doesn't really bother Mii@because she can go play in the west as she likes?
Plus the kids at the Tomorrow Shop and Granny@are all fine.

group_1.textLeft: There's no telling after the election.
They could turn hostile towards you,@saying "it's that easterner!" again.

group_1.textRight: You mean having the eastern candidate win@was not the goal, then?

group_1.textLeft: That's right.
I only hope it will be an opportunity@for the west to look at us again in a new light.

group_1.textRight: Then with all of the bad rumors about the east@circulating in the news...

group_1.textLeft: The truth is in the dark.@Who knows if they will understand or not.
And there isn't anything I can do...

group_1.narration: Some weekly publications have reported@violations of the Public Offices Election Act@by involving minors in the election campaign.@We are working to confirm the authenticity@of these allegations as well.

group_1.textLeft: …………[wait:0.8][chara:101700:cheek_0][chara:101700:face_mtn_ex_052.exp.json][chara:101700:lipSynch_1]Because of me?

group_1.progressNarration: [textBlack:In the talk show corner that continued,@the person in question@flashed on the television screen,@desperate to defend himself@from the allegations raised@by the media.]
[textBlack:There were indeed minors who helped,@but they were in compliance with the law,@he said. Just by listening to the show,@Mikage and I both knew@it was specifically about Miss Mitama.]
[textBlack:When I took my eyes off the screen,@I couldn't tell if Miss Mitama was sad or angry.@She stared at the screen@with a look of mixed feelings.]
